name: Malleswara heritage walk.
description: Step into the heart of one of Bangalore’s oldest suburbs as we take you on a journey through time. Join us for a captivating ‘darshan’ of the many temples and religious institutions that have shaped the soul of this neighborhood. As we walk these historic streets, we’ll unravel the origins of Malleswaram and share fascinating stories of the renowned personalities who once called it home.Discover the lesser-known Maratha connection to this locality and hear the inspiring tale of a visionary philanthropist who not only restored the sacred Kadu Malleswara Temple but also created an entire lake—an enduring gift to the community.But this walk isn’t just about the past—it’s also a reflection on the present. Witness how Kadu Malleswara has gradually transformed into "Mall-e-swarm," where heritage structures and local culture are slowly fading into history. And amidst these stories of change, we’ll take a delicious pause at an iconic eatery, savoring flavors that have stood the test of time.Join us for this immersive experience and see Malleswaram like never before!

name: Dialogues with Books: Monthly Meetup
description: Join Bangalore`s Iconic Book Community - Monthly DWB Meetup! 📚Join Dialogues with Books (DWB) for our monthly gathering where fellow bibliophiles come together to celebrate the joy of reading!What We`ll Do -Come with a book you`ve been enjoying lately - any genre welcome! We`ll all share what we`re reading, why it resonates with us, and dive into lively discussions about the stories and ideas that captivate us. Feel free to read favourite passages aloud and discover your next great read through fellow bibliophiles` recommendations.Expect an evening of engaging book conversations over warm beverages, light snacks, and great company!About DWB - Dialogues with Books is one of Bangalore`s oldest book communities, creating a vibrant, inclusive space where literature lovers share their passion and form lasting friendships through books. Whether you`re a seasoned reader or looking to reconnect with reading, you`ll find a warm welcome here.DWB is Perfect For: Book enthusiasts, readers wanting to discover new genres, and anyone seeking thoughtful literary conversations in Bangalore`s vibrant reading community.Location: Dialogues KoramangalaMeet Your Host: Bharat - Bharat is an avid reader, writer, and passionate bibliophile with eclectic literary tastes spanning classics, fiction, philosophy, poetry, and self-improvement. His favorite authors include Hemingway, Murakami, Mishima, P.G. Wodehouse, and Edgar Allan Poe. His infectious enthusiasm for books and skill at facilitating discussions makes every meetup both stimulating and enjoyable.

name: Ramzan iftar walk in Fraser town.
description: Join us on this exclusive Ramzan Iftar party in Fraser town where our guests get to feast on a spread consisting of more than 12-14 different courses of Muslim cuisine from different parts of the country.Some of the dishes available to taste are Harira Samosas Brain puffs Haleem Kutt Sheermal naan with chicken/mutton gravy 2-3 types of biryani desserts like egg pudding khubani ka meetha Shawarma rolls Quail sheekh kebabs Double ka meetha Khoya naan Chauba puri and naan Halwa puri etc. Some of the delicacies to be served will be home-made & are not available anywhere. In between all these food you get some great Sulaimani chai too.In between bites get a few bytes of the local history as well as the tradition of Ramzan & fasting in Islam.+++NOTE : All dishes mentioned are subject to availability.+++Some old snaps here-https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.1462870957356656.1073741830.1455202794790139PS: In order to enjoy this feast please fast during the day.#Ramzaniftarwalk #iftarwalk #ramzanfood #frasertownfoodwalk #mosqueroadfoodwalk

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

name: Qu for Quiz
description: The Qu for Quiz is based on a grid format with the grids formed by topics on one axis and level of difficulty (and hence the points) on the other. The topics could be varied like History, Sports, Music, Literature, Movies and more. A team of two members would get to choose a topic and the level of difficulty and the question would be revealed. The rest of the teams can go for the buzzer if they know the answer. Depending on the number of teams registering, the size of the grid would be decided.Ganesh Balakrishnan is an entrepreneur, marketer and creator of terrible dad jokes. His claim to fame is attempting to sell shoes during the pandemic, culminating in a viral Shark Tank "Down But Not Out" appearance. He is a collector of useless facts since childhood, and has dabbled in trivia quiz circuits since college. ganesh.flatheads@gmail.comKarthik Srinivasan is a pseudo-retired software leader by choice, specializing in innovative ideas to spend time that include organizing cricket leagues at the scale of IPL but for free, staying up to date on latest debates in virtual social groups helmed by family and friends and more on similar lines. emailkarth@gmail.com

name: Food In Literature Book Club
description: Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of foodliterature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well. So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us for a dialogue on “Food in Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we read our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.February Read: The Food of Paradise by Khalid JawedWe assure you that you will enjoy every single bite!The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available. Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who to love to read and eat!When: Saturday, 28th February, 2026 at 11 a.m.Where: Atta Galatta Bookstore, Indira NagarAges: 18+Registration is mandatory (link in bio)Copies of the book are available at the store.

name: Poetry Open Mic
description: Event Name: Mohlat: Zamaane ke fasaane seTheme: Poetry, Storytelling & Unfiltered ConversationsIn a city that runs on deadlines, traffic, and endless scrolling, when was the last time you truly paused?Mohlat (meaning 'respite' or 'grace period') is not just an event; it is a sanctuary carved out of time. We invite you to "Zamaane ke fasaane se"—an intimate evening dedicated to the art of slowing down.This is a space where the noise of the world fades away, replaced by the rhythm of poetry and the warmth of stories. Whether you are a Shayar with a diary full of couplets, a storyteller with a memory to share, or a listener looking for sukoon (peace), you belong here.WHAT TO EXPECT ✨ The Mehfil Vibe: Forget cold auditoriums. Imagine warm lights, floor seating (cushions and rugs), and a circle of strangers who feel like old friends.🎙️ The Open Mic: The stage is open to everyone. Hindi, Urdu, English, or Hinglish—language is no barrier when the emotion is real. Share your Nazms, Ghazals, or free-verse stories.☕ Chai & Guftagu: What is a poetry session without tea? Enjoy light refreshments and engage in meaningful conversations during our breaks.WHO IS THIS FOR?The Writer who has been hiding their poetry in the Notes app.The Listener who finds comfort in the words of others.The Soul looking to disconnect from screens and reconnect with people.NOTE: This is a zero-judgment zone. You don't need to be a professional performer. You just need to be authentic.

name: Brand Basics for First-Time Entrepreneurs
description: A conversation-led space for people who want to start something of their own but feel stuck at the very beginning, unsure of what they’re really building, how to explain it, or where to begin.This workshop is about slowing down, asking better questions, and finding the right words before you promote, market, or invest further. The focus is on clarity, in thought, language, and direction, so everything that comes later feels more intentional and less overwhelming.Who is this for?First-time entrepreneurs, professionals exploring a side venture, freelancers seeking clarity in how they present their work, MSME owners who want to make sense of branding without jargon, and students or anyone considering starting something of their own.What will participants take away?1. Greater clarity on what they’re really building and why it matters2. A simple way to articulate their idea with confidence and intention3. A clearer understanding of how branding, marketing, and storytelling fit together, before execution beginsPlease complete the registration form after booking. It helps us understand what you’re working on so the session can be shaped around the room. https://forms.gle/vescHTWDZhn722Jz6

name: Art Meet-Cute
description: Art Meet-Cute is a gentle evening where strangers sit around a table with paper, colours and small prompts, and let conversations grow naturally. Instead of practiced introductions, you’ll make something with your hands. Instead of awkward questions, there’ll be art, shared silences, small jokes, and the comfort of being around kind people.Come alone. Leave with a page, a memory, or a feeling you can’t quite explain yet.No pressure. No labels. Let art do the talking - the rest can happen between the lines.The space will be gently held and facilitated by Your Journal Project (Yukti).You’ll get: all art materials & thoughtful curiosity-led promptsYou’ll take: your artwork, a new third place to quietly call home, and maybe a date… or at the very least, a friend.NOTE: ₹200 cover fully redeemable on F&B at the venue.

name: Dinner with strangers by StepOut (Bengaluru)
description: Serendipity on a TableStepOut Dinners bring strangers together at some of the city’s best restaurants for an evening that feels easy, warm, and unexpectedly meaningful.You are seated at a small, thoughtfully curated table with people you would likely never meet otherwise. Different backgrounds, different stories, one shared meal. The crowd is balanced, open minded, and there by choice, not chance. No loud networking. No awkward icebreakers. Just good food, unforced conversations, and the kind of listening that rarely happens in daily life.The restaurants are carefully chosen. Comfortable, well loved spaces where you can settle in and talk without rushing. The focus is not on the menu alone, but on the atmosphere that allows connection to unfold naturally.Some nights are light and playful. Some go deeper than expected. Some surprise you quietly. That is the point.StepOut Dinners are not about dating or outcomes. They are about discovery. Showing up. Sitting down. Letting the table do its quiet work.Sometimes, all it takes is one seat at the right table for life to feel a little more open. For more information, visit www.stepout.world

description: Turtle Forum is 3-day residential bootcamp (23–25 April, Bengaluru) designed for development practitioners working on social media, communications, and fundraising. name: away.to.laugh
description: A comedy night about work, AI, burnout, bosses, and the strange future we’re all living through.Some weeks deserve a better ending.Not loud music.Not forced plans.Just four comics doing what they do best in a room that actually listens.What this night is about:Work has become strange.AI is everywhere.Meetings never end.Everyone is “building something.”Everyone is tired.So we’re doing the only sensible thing. Laughing at it.a.way.to.laugh is built around the modern workplace.Office politics. Startup chaos. Corporate jargon. Burnout. Productivity obsession. LinkedIn behaviour. The fear that a robot might do your job better than you.And yes, they’re allowed to roast away too.The wellness. The productivity vibe. The quiet workspace philosophy. All fair game.What kind of night this is:Not a shouty comedy club.Not crowd work for Instagram.Not jokes rushed between drinks.This is sit down.Pay attention.Laugh when it hits.A room full of people who work hard, think too much, and needed a night like this.Because if there’s one place where jokes about work should land hardest, it’s inside a workspace.P.S-🍻 BYOB

name: Prakriti Pravaham
description: About the Event:Vidhushi Lalgudi Vijayalakshmi will be presenting a Carnatic violin concert with a theme inspired by the 5 elements of nature. She will be accompanied by Vidwan Tumkur Ravishankar on the mridangam and Vidwan Pramath Kiran on the Tabla and Morsing. The concert will take place on 21st Feb from 6-8pm at Courtyard Koota, Kengeri and tickets can be purchased at courtyardkoota.comAbout the ArtistsLalgudi VijayalakshmiA fifth-generation musician of the illustrious Lalgudi bani, Lalgudi Vijayalakshmi, daughter and disciple of legendary musician, Lalgudi G Jayaraman, is an artiste who engages both deeply and variedly with her music. As a violinist, she performs solo, duet, as an accompanist and collaborates with artistes across genres. She is also an accomplished vocalist, a composer, and a teacher. As a composer, besides musical compositions such as thillanas, varnams and krithis, she has also composed both lyrics and music for full length dance dramas, and set to tune works of great poets. With a sparkling four-decade-long journey in music, Vijayalakshmi has been recognized for her music through a slew of awards and accolades, including the most prestigious Sangita Kalanidhi by The Music Academy. A compliment she holds as particularly special is one that Pandit Ravi Shankar ji, the legendary sitar maestro showered on her, following her performance in the United States a few years ago - “You have your father’s fingers. Your music has touched my soul”. In her trust Krutagnya (Sanskrit for gratitude), Vijayalakshmi has been working to create awareness about the varied aspects of music and provide a stage for budding violinists from different schools to showcase their talent.S G Pramath KiranS G Pramath Kiran, a distinguished percussionist, music producer, and sound engineer, is a leading musician in India. Having embarked on his musical journey at the age of 3, he possesses expertise in both Carnatic and Hindustani music. Renowned for collaborations with top musicians worldwide, he founded Laya Digi Studios, producing numerous records. Notably, he's a featured artist in a Grammy award-winning album Devine Tides by Ricky Kej, showcasing his exceptional musical prowess.Tumkur B. RavishankarTumkur B. Ravishankar is a senior Mridangam artist and a Top Grade Artist of All India Radio and Doordarshan. He hails from a family of traditional Mridangam musicians. He began his training under his father, Sri Tumkur T. V. Bhadrachar, and later received advanced training from the renowned maestro Guru Sri Karaikudi R. Mani.Known for his clarity and control across both slow and fast tempos, Ravishankar has accompanied many leading Carnatic musicians. He has performed extensively in India and abroad and has received several titles and awards. He is currently associated with Akashvani, Mysuru, as a Top Grade Mridangam Artist.Tickets are mandatory for all.*

organizer.description: Building connections between the art, artists and audience through experiences that inspire, inform and entertain!

name: Miniature wood carving- Idam
description: The most awaited workshop is back!Hola, Psydex is bringing back the ancient forgotten craft to your city. Be a part of this unique experience and take home your miniature carvings.In today's world where all of us who live in cities have a busy and high paced lifestyle, we are constantly engrossed in the digital world and barely get time for ourselves. More than this valuable time, what's missing is a tool or a way to calm down and pause your stress and anxiety amidst this survival race. A moment to breathe consciously, a moment to love ourselves and a moment to share our little joys is what we actually need. And that's exactly what we are offering you.In this three and a half hour workshop you will not only learn about wood, 3D visualization and different techniques with the tool but also discover a way to calm your mind and reconnect with yourself and nature.This carving workshop is very beginner-friendly and suitable for all ages. It will be very interactive and engaging. Our expert, Nitish, will teach you all the basics and guide you through every step to help you achieve what you desire to carve.Who can attend the workshop?An absolute amateur wanting to try carvingAny beginner seeking to pursue a hobbyAnyone over 14 yrs of age, below that the kid must be accompanied by a parentWhat you need to bring?A fresh mind, rest assured we got you covered.

location.address: 2nd floor, On top, of Tree House Cafe, Rajkumar Park Rd, PNS Layout, Chinnappa Layout, Subbayianiah Palyam, Kammanahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560043, India

organizer.name: Psydex
organizer.description: Psydex? Well, if you ask, honestly it has no meaning. In fact, its two halves merged into one-PSYchedelics and DEXterity. No, we don't sell drugs. Those are not two words but an identity of what we sell. We offer tools which, if used dexterously, can put you in an altered state of awareness.

name: The Sleep Reset Workshop
description: You’re exhausted, but your mind won’t switch off.You lie down, but your body stays alert.You sleep, but you don’t wake up rested.This isn’t a lack of discipline.This is a dysregulated nervous system.Join our sleep reset workshop to experience nervous-system reset for people who are tired of not being able to sleep. A science-backed aromatherapy, breathwork, and nervous-system regulation— practiced in your own bedroom, in real time.​No generic sleep tips.No forced meditation.No tracking, pills, or pressure.

location.address: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

organizer.name: Krypa Wellness
organizer.description: Krypa Wellness is a sleep-focused wellness house using neuroscience-backed aromatherapy to relieve insomnia and chronic sleep disruption at the nervous system level—without drugs or sedatives.

name: The Love Village
description: Have you noticed how every gadget, appliance, or machine comes with a user manual?It tells us how it works, what not to do, and how to handle it when something goes wrong.Now imagine this for a moment…What if the people we love came with a manual?A simple guide that said:– This is how I feel loved– This is why I shut down or get angry during conflict– This is what I need when I’m overwhelmed– This is how I react when I feel unseenRelationships would feel so much easier, wouldn’t they?The truth is; we do have patterns.And so do the people we love.They’re shaped by our attachment styles and love languages.💛 Love Village is an experiential workshop where we explore exactly this:How you love. Why you react the way you do. And what keeps repeating in your relationships.This workshop is for you if:✔️ You feel your loved ones don’t really “get” you✔️ You shut down, feel anxious, or get angry during conflict✔️ You often give more than you receive✔️ You struggle with communication; even with people you care deeply about👥 For singles, couples, and close friendships📅 Saturday | 21st Feb 2026🕒 3:30 – 7:30 PMIf you’ve ever wished for a user guide to understand yourself and your loved ones better,this space is for you.Registrations are now open.We’d love to have you with us at Love Village 🤍Meet the Facilitators:Mamtha Rajesh is the founder of Utsmaya and a psychotherapist with 26 years of experience working intensively with 1000s of clients across 16 countries, cultures, and age groups.Mihika Rajesh is a Psychotherapist working with individuals supporting them in understanding their inner worlds and is trained in inner child healing. She holds an MSC in Mental Health from the University of Edinburgh.Muskan Siyal is a Psychotherapist working with young and middle-aged adults, offering reflection and warmth through the many transitions of adulthood. She holds an MSc in Clinical Psychology.

name: V-Day: A love letter in 5 Acts - 5-course Tasting
description: The Five Acts of Love at Café FioriThis Valentine’s weekend, Café Fiori presents The Five Acts of Love; a five-course tasting experience designed for those who love food as much as they love good company.The menu unfolds like a play, with each course marking an act - beginning with bright, fresh flavours, moving through warmth and spice, settling into comforting handmade pastas, and finishing with layered desserts built around chocolate, citrus, and subtle florals. Expect seasonal ingredients, house-made elements, and European-inspired plates that are thoughtful, indulgent, and meant to be enjoyed slowly.This is not a typical Valentine’s dinner. It’s an experience for couples, friends, and anyone who enjoys sharing a table and discovering flavours together. With limited seatings each evening, the tasting is paced and intimate, allowing every course its moment.📍 Café Fiori, Whitefield📅 14th & 15th February🕰 Two curated seatings per evening🍽 Limited seats | Reservations onlyCome hungry, linger longer, and experience a Valentine’s weekend shaped around food, craft, and connection, one act at a time.

name: THT presents Macbeth with The Handlebards (UK)
description: The HandleBards are back in Bangalore! Join them for a high octane production of William Shakespeare’s ‘Macbeth’. Forget the tears and tragedy, our Macbeth is chock full of mishaps, mayhem and mirth. We all know the story. Three Witches promise Macbeth the Scottish crown and so Macbeth and Lady Macbeth plot to kill the king. Things get rapidly out of hand from there as foul deeds are done, plots unravel and mysterious spirits appear…Suitable for all ages and apparitions.The Humming Tree:The Humming Tree - A grassroots performance venue in Bangalore, running from 2013 to 2019 and in the process becoming a cornerstone of Bangalore’s independent music, art, and cultural ecosystem. Now, in 2026, The Humming Tree is back in a brand-new, purpose-designed space in Indiranagar. Built across 12,000 sq. ft., the venue features a 600+ capacity performance space, world-class sound and lighting systems, and a diverse F&B proposition. More than just a venue, it’s a hub for creativity, culture and collaboration.

name: The Analog Club: Valentine's Edition
description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, an event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves.Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no one taking selfies, and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! This Valentine’s edition is about slowing down and connecting the old-fashioned way — through shared moments, easy conversation, and genuine presence.The event will be fluid — dip into activities if you like, sit across from someone new and let a conversation unfold, or graze at our high tea counter. Meet new people the analog way, without profiles or algorithms — just presence, curiosity, and the simple magic of being in the same room. Sketch side by side, play a slow board game, exchange book recommendations, or read quietly in the comforting presence of others (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones).Strictly no devices (no laptops, iPads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag.  E-books are allowed.**Tickets are for entry, all games and art supplies, and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter. Do not purchase a ticket if you are unwilling to surrender your devices for 3 hours!

name: Tea-rapy:With Dr. Gokul Ratakonda & Kvira Organics
description: Get ready to pour a cup of clarity at Tea-rapy—a soulful blend of clinical insight and sensory mindfulness. This isn't your average therapy session; it’s an immersive experience designed to help you navigate the complexities of connection while grounding your senses.We’re bringing in Dr. Gokul Ratakonda, a practicing clinical psychologist, to lead a deep dive into the heart of modern dating and long-term partnerships. Alongside a curated tea ceremony and tasting by Kvira Organics, this event offers a serene space to explore the internal and external facets of love.What to Expect:The Deep Dive: An open forum to ask Dr. Ratakonda your most pressing questions about relationship dynamics and emotional health.Mindful Moments: Experience guided meditations to center your thoughts and calm the nervous system.Setting the Standard: Learn practical tools for establishing healthy boundaries and defining your relationship goals for the year ahead.Sensory Soothing: Sip and savor premium blends from Kvira Organics as you learn the art of the tea ceremony.Whether you’re looking to heal, grow, or simply find balance, come prepared to sip, speak, and set your intentions. It’s restorative, it’s enlightening, and it’s exactly the "me-time" your heart deserves.

name: G5A Baithak: An Immersive Concert
description: Baithak, a traditional concert series that creates an intimate space which embraces the subtle, unspoken moments between artist, instrument, and audience. As G5A steps beyond the warehouse, we are delighted to present Baithak, a two-part concert featuring eminent vocalist Dr. Ashwini Bhide Deshpande and sarod virtuoso Pratik Shrivastava.Baithak is supported by Julius Bär.About the artists:Dr. Ashwini Bhide Deshpande, an outstanding vocalist of the famed “Jaipur-Atrauli” Khayal Gayaki tradition, whose own introspection led her to explore new horizons of the ever-expanding terrain of Hindustani Classical Music. She will be joined by Pandit Ravindra Yavagal on tabla and Pandit Vyasmurti Katti on harmonium.And Pratik Shrivastava, a sarod artist who was initiated into the art of playing sarod at a young age of six and has continued to prove his versatility through his participation in various contemporary and fusion music projects and film scores. Pratik will be accompanied by tabla artist Tejovrush Joshi.Looking forward to welcoming you at Sabha, Bengaluru!

location.address: 262, Kamaraj Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

name: Solidarity Tuesday: Sadhana Mahila Sangha & Adavi
description: WhatSolidarity is a sense of unity. Simply put, it is showing up even if an issue doesn’t directly impact you. Solidarity Tuesday is about highlighting civic or social issues that need attention and could use our support.WhyThe Humming Tree has always had a commitment to community. Our work is to support independent artists and communities who are trying to create positive change in this world. As a venue, our intention is to give voice, platform, and resources to those who can make an impact in their communities.How Once a month, THT will host artists and social changemakers to share their journeys. All the proceeds from the food, beverage, and ticket sales will go to the community based organisation. Our commitment is to report back to our larger THT community so you know how the resources have been used.WhenOne Tuesday a monthWhoThis event is open to all. We encourage everyone to join us once a month to support organisations doing important work in our world.About Adavi Arts Collective:ADAVI is an anticaste art collective dedicated to the proliferation and promotion of folk arts. Our mission is to create a meaningful intersection between traditional folk practices and contemporary artistic expressions. At the heart of our collective is Parai, an ancient percussion instrument that embodies the spirit of celebration and community. Initiated by Naren, a seasoned folk artist and percussionist with a rich background in theater, ADAVI brings together artists who share a passion for celebrating life through art.Vision:Our vision is to build a society free from discrimination, where equality transcends caste, gender, color, religion, race, class and creed. Our collective is dedicated to fostering an inclusive world where every individual is valued, respected and empowered.Program: Taste of Self: An Encounter with Community TheatreDate: 17 February 2026Venue: Humming TreeArtist resources for the evening: Deepak Srinivasan & Sadhana Mahila SanghaDeepak Srinivasan is a theatre and media practitioner and design educator. His work focuses on storytelling and performance as methods to probe public life, specifically engaging with urban working-class groups, children, and special needs communities. He has been engaging with Sadhana Mahila Sangha over a 10 year period, to introduce them to theatre, media and art-based tools for expression and development.Sadhana Mahila Sangha is a working-class women's collective that utilizes theatre, media, and visual forms for community outreach and women’s rights. They focus on building collective strength through the reclamation of their own narratives.Part 1: Movement & Arts WorkshopTime: 6:00 PM – 6.45 PMLocation: Audience FloorFacilitated by Deepak Srinivasan, this session is a short group exploration into somatic movement and creative expression. With over 18 years of experience in design education and media practice, Deepak specializes in crafting inclusive, trans-disciplinary processes for non-actors. This workshop invites participants—from students and young adults to community members—to engage with the arts as a tool for personal and socio-cultural inquiry.Part 2: Excerpts from the community theatre piece, Hasivu-Kanasu (Hunger-Dreams)Time: 7:00 PM – 7:40 PMLocation: On-StageSadhana Mahila Sangha, a prominent Bengaluru-based collective of working-class women, presents excerpts from their original theatre production, Hasivu-Kanasu. Developed by adapting oral histories of the city's working-class communities, the performance explores the raw intersections of labour, survival, and aspiration. While the full production is a 90-minute Kannada language piece, curated excerpts will offer you a window into the collective’s lived experiences and their journey of self-expression.

name: Risky Quizness: hosted by Berty and Juno
description: Risky QuiznessRisky Quizness is a monthly venture and a sole property of The Humming Tree, that is dedicated to making quizzes a lot more fun than you remember in school or uni, or even anywhere else. This one's going to be the kind of fun you'd have playing charades with your best buddies on a Sunday night, except with exciting prizes to be won and an audience to cheer you on! (And of course liquid courage and encouragement ;)This session's theme: Music QuizOne good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain," said Bob Marley. We are going to hit the scene with the most exciting concept in a long time. Sing along or air guitar along with the host! Relive nostalgia or dance to your favorite tunes! Your quizmasters are Berty Ashley and Arjun Mohan. Both of them are established quizmasters and have been conducting quizzes at colleges, corporate events, and pubs across the country.But more importantly, they are both musicians and music lovers! From Barbie Girl to Bach, from Owl City to Opeth, David Guetta to David Gilmour.. whatever music you listen to, we have the groove for you! For singing your favorite song you get an opportunity to win prizes! YES! Come, sing, dance, groove, answer and claim your prize! We urge you to: Play the moments, pause the memories, stop the pain, rewind the happiness along with us as we take you down a musical journey of discovery!Quiz guidelines1. There are 6 different rounds2. All answers will have to be written down. We will provide you with the quiz answer sheets.3. Different rounds will comprise of different kinds of engaging questions, inclusive of questions with audio and visual elements. You might need to be up on your feet and up on stage to give different skills a little shake.4. Only 2 - 4 participants per table.5. The team with the highest total at the end of the quiz gets a bonus prize to end the night.

description: Directed by Pritesh Bhandary, Atta Galatta brings you Madonna.This bold, darkly funny and deeply intimate two-part play explores female desire, emotional neglect, sexual shame, and the search for pleasure and self-worth—in a world that constantly teaches women to stay silent.

name: Steeped in Scandal: An intimate tea-time session
description: Known for her sweeping tales of mythology and history, Anuja is stepping away from the epic battles to indulge in some delicious, modern-day gossip with us. This isn’t your average literary talk—this is your chance to play investigator. We’re inviting you to submit your most "gossipy" questions for Anuja to answer live. Whether you're curious about the scandals behind her stories or want her to take on a provocative prompt, no topic is too bold and no secret is safe over a cup of chai.Come for the tea, stay for the revelations!Bio:Anuja Chandramouli is a bestselling author and new age Indian classicist widely regarded as one of the finest writers in mythology, historical fiction and fantasy. Her highly acclaimed debut novel, Arjuna: Saga of a Pandava Warrior-Prince, was named as one of the top 5 sellers in the Indian writing category for the year 2012 by Amazon India. Her book, Mohini: The Enchantress was the winner of the JK Papers and Times of India Popular Choice Author award for the year 2021. Her books are also available as audiobooks and have been translated into Hindi. Abhimanyu: Son of Arjuna has been shortlisted for the Atta Galatta – Bangalore Literature Festival Book Prize. GIRL TALK and THE WIFE AND THE DANCING GIRL are her latest books. An accomplished TEDx speaker and storyteller, Anuja Chandramouli, regularly conducts workshops on creative writing, mythology and empowerment in schools and colleges across the country. Her Mahabharata and Ramayana with Anuja storytelling series is now available on YouTube, Spotify, TuneIn Alexa, Apple Podcasts. She is a trained Bharatanatyam dancer and a columnist for The New Indian Express. This mother of two little girls lives in Sivakasi, Tamil Nadu.

name: Miniature wood carving- TWC
description: The most awaited workshop is back!Hola, Psydex is bringing back the ancient forgotten craft to your city. Be a part of this unique experience and take home your miniature carvings.In today's world where all of us who live in cities have a busy and high paced lifestyle, we are constantly engrossed in the digital world and barely get time for ourselves. More than this valuable time, what's missing is a tool or a way to calm down and pause your stress and anxiety amidst this survival race. A moment to breathe consciously, a moment to love ourselves and a moment to share our little joys is what we actually need. And that's exactly what we are offering you.In this three and a half hour workshop you will not only learn about wood, 3D visualization and different techniques with the tool but also discover a way to calm your mind and reconnect with yourself and nature.This carving workshop is very beginner-friendly and suitable for all ages. It will be very interactive and engaging. Our expert, Nitish, will teach you all the basics and guide you through every step to help you achieve what you desire to carve.Who can attend the workshop?An absolute amateur wanting to try carvingAny beginner seeking to pursue a hobbyAnyone over 14 yrs of age, below that the kid must be accompanied by a parentWhat you need to bring?A fresh mind, rest assured we got you covered.

organizer.name: Psydex
organizer.description: Psydex? Well, if you ask, honestly it has no meaning. In fact, its two halves merged into one-PSYchedelics and DEXterity. No, we don't sell drugs. Those are not two words but an identity of what we sell. We offer tools which, if used dexterously, can put you in an altered state of awareness.

name: Bangalore StarGazing Astro Camp 07_08 Mar 2026
description: A Night Under the Infinite: Join us for an extraordinary stargazing experience where the cosmos unfolds above you.Witness the stunning Geminid meteor shower as streaks of light dance across the sky. Observe planets, stars, and deep-sky wonders through high-powered telescopes. Learn captivating stories behind constellations and celestial objects. Enjoy guided sky tours designed for beginners, families, and young explorers. Experience the calm of nature paired with the thrill of real astronomy. Ask questions, interact, and deepen your understanding of the night sky. Perfect for children eager to learn and adults who seek cosmic wonder.Come be part of a night where curiosity meets the universe—an unforgettable journey.Please call us on 9945203390 for more details/Bookings

name: Lotus Pond Resin Pour
description: Experience the beauty of resin art in our Lotus Pond Resin Art Workshop at Fired Up Studio. This guided, hands-on session introduces participants to the basics of resin art while creating a serene lotus pond–inspired artwork. You will learn how to layer, paint, and work with resin to build depth, colour, and a water-like finish that brings the artwork to life.The workshop covers essential techniques such as colour mixing, layering for realistic effects, and controlled pouring. Along the way, you’ll also receive additional tips for resin art, including surface preparation, curing guidance, and finishing techniques to help you continue exploring resin art beyond the session. No prior experience is required, making this workshop suitable for beginners as well as art enthusiasts.All materials are provided, and you’ll take home a beautiful finished artwork at the end of the workshop. If you’re looking for creative or resin art experiences,  unique things to do over the weekend, this is right up your alley. This lotus pond resin workshop offers a calming, immersive way to learn a new skill and create something truly special.

name: Sonam Kalra & The Sufi Gospel Project
description: Where voices of faith meet, music becomes a shared language.Conceived by singer and composer Sonam Kalra, Sonam Kalra & The Sufi Gospel Project weaves together song, music and the spoken word to explore belief across cultures. Traditional western gospels meld with Indian classical sounds, and Indian spiritual texts are enriched by elements of western poetry to  reveal that no matter what the language of the lyrics, or the ethnicity of the sounds, there is but one language, the language of faith.Across languages, traditions and forms, the music points to a shared truth. That faith, like music, speaks in many voices but carries one spirit.

name: Japanese Kintsugi
description: Join the exclusive Japanese Kintsugi workshop by Aabha.A 500-year-old Japanese art form, Kintsugi teaches us to mend broken pieces with gold, honouring cracks instead of hiding them. Rooted in the philosophy of wabi-sabi, it celebrates imperfection, resilience, and the beauty of transformation, where what was once broken becomes more valuable than before.In this hands-on workshop, you’ll experience the quiet meditative process of repairing ceramics, learning how restoration itself can become an art and a gentle reminder that flaws tell stories worth preserving.

The highlight of the session is a hidden, peel-and-reveal message inside the cake, making it a truly memorable Valentine’s keepsake.No baking or prior experience required—all materials, tools, and a pre-baked cake are provided. Guided by our instructor, you’ll decorate, personalise, and take home a half-kg cake decorated entirely by YOU.Perfect for:• Valentine’s Day date ideas• Creative things to do in the city• Cake decorating & baking enthusiasts• Couples looking for a fun, hands-on experienceCome for the creativity, stay for the surprise, and leave with a cake (and memories) made with love. 💕🍰Location: Located inside Biere st with ample car and two wheeler parking. name: Get Started with Freelancing - 1 Day Workshop
description: ​Get Started with Freelancing​Build your freelance business in one day. Structure, tools, and a system that works.​The Problem​You want to freelance. You don't know what to charge, how to position yourself, or where to find clients.​Every tutorial gives you pieces. This workshop gives you the complete structure.​What You'll Build​In 6 hours, you'll create:​✅ 6 strategy documents - positioning, pricing, services, client qualification, marketing, portfolio✅ Your own AI business advisor - trained on your specific business✅ A live website - no-code, ready to share​This isn't just support. It's plug-and-play templates, playbooks, and a scalable model.​How It Works​Morning: The 6 Foundations​Work through 6 exercises using physical prompt cards. Upload your answers to Claude. Generate professional strategy documents.​Map it out. Price it out. Scope it out. Filter it out. Put it out. Build it out.​Afternoon: Build Your Tools​Create a custom AI advisor (ChatGPT or Claude) trained on your 6 documents. Launch your website using Antigravity. No coding required.​Who This Is For​You're not here to hustle harder - you're here to build smarter.​This workshop is for:​People with skills who don't know how to sell them​Anyone stuck on pricing, positioning, or packaging​Beginners who want structure, not guesswork​Anyone ready to use AI tools the right way​Whether you're starting fresh or scaling up, there's a place in this system for you.​What to Bring​Laptop (charged)​Basic idea of what you want to offer​Willingness to build​We provide the cards, templates, frameworks, lunch, and coffee.​Details​📅 Date: Sunday, 15th February 2026Time: 9 AM - 4 PM📍 Location: away.center💰 Price: ₹699/-​Limited spots for hands-on support.​Quick Answers​No portfolio? We'll build your strategy anyway.Don't know AI tools? We'll teach you.Not sure what to offer? We'll help you figure it out.Working website by end of day? Yes.​Questions?Email rashid@freelancefirst.org​AI is shifting work. We're shifting the system - with you at the center.​No fluff. No middlemen. Just the real stuff that moves you forward

name: The Future Series (TFS)
description: What is it?The Future Series is where curious minds gather to stretch imagination and swap ideas about what’s next — from biotech to AI to blockchain to new ways of living.It’s a space to reimagine the future — and design one worth getting excited about.What to expect?An evening of two punchy (15–20 min) lightning talks by people who are pushing the boundaries in their fields — followed by a relaxed Q&A and fun conversations over good food and drinks.Format🕕 6:15 pm – Arrive, check in, grab a drink🕖 7:00 pm – Talk 1: Building Data Centers with Biomolecules by Anagha Rajesh🕢 7:30 pm – Talk 2: Anti Trauma Social Organising Hypothesis by Gowtham Sundararaju🕗 8:00 pm – Open floor, meet people, share ideas🕣 8:30 pm – Wrap up (but conversations can spill over)​What’s the vibe?Brau Galie, Koramangala brings craft beer, mellow light, unhurrried conversations and a crowd that values good thinking as much as good drinks.​Who is it for?For the curiously ambitious.Builders, thinkers, dreamers — anyone who’s working on, or just obsessed with bending the future.​Is it paid?Free tickets are available for early-birds and paid tickets which is small cover to keep the gathering intentional. Beers and mocktails on us.About usThe Future Series is an initiative by ZuGrama, the team behind India’s first pop-up village held in Kerala earlier last year.Over 6 weeks, 150+ people from around the world came together to explore the edges of technology, culture, and philosophy — with past speakers including Vitalik Buterin, Trent McConaghy, and more.​✨ Limited seats. RSVP soon before we run out of spots.See you there :)

description: Spend a relaxed, creative hour with Pawga and some very special shelter pups. This is a slow, guided clay-modelling session where you’re free to shape anything you like using kid-safe and pet-safe air-dry clay. All materials and gentle prompts are provided - you just need to show up and enjoy the process.As you work with the clay, the puppies will move around the space, curl up beside you, break the ice, and add warmth to the experience. All the pups come from local shelters and are up for adoption, and a portion of each ticket goes towards their care.Please note that this is air-dry clay, and you’re welcome to take your creations home. It’s an easy, feel-good way to unwind, try something hands-on, and spend time with dogs who genuinely enjoy the company.You’re welcome to arrive 10-15 minutes early and stay back a little after the session for extra puppy time.Seats tend to fill up quickly - book your spot soon🐾

name: Bangalore Self Love Circle Yoga with Puppies
description: Spend a calming, feel-good hour with Pawga and some very special shelter pups. This beginner-friendly, guided yoga session is designed to help you slow down, reconnect, and move mindfully at your own pace - no prior yoga experience needed.As you flow through gentle stretches and breathwork, the puppies will naturally move around the space, curl up beside you, and bring a sense of warmth and lightness to the session. Rather than lifting or involving them directly in the practice, we create a shared environment that feels comfortable and safe for both you and the dogs.Rooted in heartfulness, the self-love puppy yoga circle is an invitation to pause, be present, and turn your attention inward, reminding yourself to nurture and love who you are, first.All the pups come from local shelters and are up for adoption, and a portion of each ticket goes towards supporting their care.Seats tend to fill up quickly - book your spot soon 🐾

name: Soul Return Author Reading
description: In Soul Return, spiritual healer Yash Jegathesan invites you on an extraordinary journey across sacred lands from the temples of South India to the Himalayas, from ancient forests to hidden caves where the boundaries between the physical and divine dissolve.Through profound lived experienceswith Siva, Goddess Amman (Parvati), Nandi,and Rishi Vashistha, Yash reveals what it meansto Master Your Heritage Living and to awaken the power of ancestral memory in your own life.This theatre reading with music offers a first shared moment: an opening into the world of the book and the emerging film.No explanations. Just presence, listening, and time. Soul Return Author Reading and Music Theatre - at Bangalore International Centre | Yash FoundationA rare literary–musical encounter on memory, ancestry, and returnStep into an intimate hour where story, sound, and silence meet.Soul Return is not a conventional book reading. It is a living experience, part author reading, part sonic atmosphere, part shared reflection. In this special session at Bangalore International Centre, author Yash Jegathesan reads selected passages from Soul Return, accompanied by original, unreleased film music by composer Dr. Norbert Ammermann.The words are not explained.They are entered.As the reading unfolds, gentle expressions of light and music open a contemplative space, inviting listeners into themes of ancestral memory, grief, belonging, and ethical responsibility. This is a pause from speed, from performance, from noise. A moment to listen deeply within and without.Why attend?Experience Soul Return as it was intended: heard, felt, and sharedWitness a rare collaboration between literature and cinematic musicEngage with a work that resists labels and invites reflection rather than instructionIdeal for readers, artists, cultural thinkers, and those drawn to depth and stillnessEvent Details📅15 February 2026⏰12:00 PM – 1:00 PM📍Bangalore International Centre1st Floor, Seminar Hall 1Indiranagar, BengaluruThis is a limited-seat, intimate gathering.Come not to consume but to encounter.

name: The Prophet and the Poet
description: About the play:The Prophet and the Poet is based on the exchange of letters and articles between Mahatma Gandhi and Rabindranath Tagore over 25 years, with the Indian freedom struggle as the backdrop. The letters reveal how the two personalities differed significantly on the form and content of the freedom movement. The differences widened over the years. However, the depth of their personalities maintained genuine respect for each other in spite of deep differences on ideological grounds. It reflected the political maturity of those times in India. Bangalore Little Theatre was privileged to be invited to stage the opening shows of the play at the places hallowed by Gandhi and Tagore in their lifetime – Sabarmati Ashram, Santiniketan (Visva Bharati) and Jorasanko in Kolkata. The Kolkata performance was at the courtyard stage of Thakurbadi, the Tagore ancestral home, now a heritage site looked after by Rabindra Bharati University. On the occasion of Gurudev Rabindranath Tagore’s birth anniversary, the play was staged at the Raj Bhavan, Bangalore, with the President of India in attendance. Later, the play was performed by invitation in Dhaka and Chittagong, Bangladesh, as part of the India-Bangladesh Joint Celebrations of Tagore’s 150th birth anniversary. Prasar Bharati commissioned a tele-film of the play. The film was telecast several times over Independence Day and Gandhi Jayanti. There have been about 130 performances of the play since its opening. The play has generated much interestoutside India as well. It has had two American productions, one in Houston and the other at the University of Iowa. Productions in UK and Ireland are also planned. A highly successful tour of Trinidad & Tobago was followed by performances in Singapore, co-hosted by Tagore Society and the Indian High Commission. The play was invited to Sydney for celebrations of Gandhi’s 150th birth anniversary. An enriching experience ... Times of India, KolkataEnthralled ... President Pratibha Patil at Raj Bhavan A moving evening, elevating The Hindu, Bangalore Exalting and inspiring experience ... New Indian Express, BangaloreEnlightening ... melody from fascinating verbal images ... Times of India, Ahmedabad Powerful and enlightening ... The Star, Dhaka The audience thoroughly enjoyed every bit of this play ... a standing ovation ... Deccan Herald, Bangalore. Simply superb ... a rare non-fiction drama. Shunya Theatre, Houston Gandhi, Tagore leave Trinidad & Tobago spellbound ... Guardian, Trinidad. Highly educative, an extraordinary production ... Faculty, University of Chittagong Amazing presentation, outstanding performance ... Indian High Commissioner, Singapore Every Indian must see this play .... Prof. CNR Rao, Bharat RatnaInspiring history, beautifully presented ... Gerson daCunha A great message for today’s highly polarized world ... Indian Link, Sydney. Important history, beautifully recreated. India International Centre Truly inspiring presentation of important history ... Ashoka UniversityMoving and compelling ... Indian Institute of Management Ahmedabad Greatly privileged to have this presented by a member of our founding faculty ... IIM Bangalore. Extraordinary presentation of very relevant history ... Dr. Souraja TagoreAbout Vijay PadakiVijay Padaki is a Theatre Educator based in Bangalore. He has worn two caps all his life with equal facility. He has been active in the theatre for over sixty years. He has been a management professional for over forty-five years.Vijay joined Bangalore Little Theatre in 1960, the year of its inception, and later served the company in many capacities – as actor, director, trainer, writer, designer and administrator. In 2008, Bangalore Little Theatre Foundation was restructured as a Public Charitable Trust. It was done with the purpose of reinforcing the organisation’s commitment to social development goals beyond performance. The Trust requested Vijay to provide the leadership to a newly-created Academy of Theatre Arts in its formative years.Age 16+

name: Bangalore StarGazing Astro Camp 21_22 Mar 2026
description: A Night Under the Infinite: Join us for an extraordinary stargazing experience where the cosmos unfolds above you.Witness the stunning Geminid meteor shower as streaks of light dance across the sky. Observe planets, stars, and deep-sky wonders through high-powered telescopes. Learn captivating stories behind constellations and celestial objects. Enjoy guided sky tours designed for beginners, families, and young explorers. Experience the calm of nature paired with the thrill of real astronomy. Ask questions, interact, and deepen your understanding of the night sky. Perfect for children eager to learn and adults who seek cosmic wonder.Come be part of a night where curiosity meets the universe—an unforgettable journey.Please call us on 9945203390 for more details/Bookings

name: Hard to Starboard
description: Hard to Starboard is a rock band formed by four enthusiastic teenagers on instruments and one old veteran on vocals. We came together in a democratic learning setup and are inspired by iconic bands like Queen, Pink floyd, rhcp, Linkin park, iron maiden and more! Juggling school schedules and jam sessions we try our best to keep our love for rock going and hope to bring you the same! All of our previous shows have been hugely successful with a wonderful audience rocking to classics such asSultans of swing, comfortably numb, smells like teen spirit, don't stop me now, numb, hey jude, can't stop and many more!We hope you can join us on the 22nd for an energetic and music filled evening!We have:Roshan — DrumsShaurya — KeyboardPranav — Lead GuitarVedant — BassShakti — VocalsCatch us LIVE on 22nd February at Soundglitz. We’re ready to turn up the volume and rock the night with you. 🤘🔥👉 Follow us on Instagram for updates, clipshttps://www.instagram.com/hardtostarboard_band?igsh=MWs2dmJmMXk5Mm0zNw==

name: Singles Only Coffee Run (Café Run)
description: Hey There!Still got no Valentine’s Day plans?Or pretending it’s just another day? 👀We’ve got something better.The Singles Only Coffee Run is a curated, low-pressure social run designed for singles who want to do something fun, active, and genuinely social - without dating-app energy.We’ll run / brisk-walk to 3 cafés, each about 1–1.5 km apart, with coffee stops, ice-breaking games and easy conversations along the way. No forced interactions. No awkward setups. Just movement, caffeine, and meeting people IRL in a way that feels natural.This is not a dating event - it’s about community, connection, and showing up.What to ExpectEasy-paced run / brisk walk (beginner friendly)Café hopping to 3 partner cafésIce-breakers & fun community gamesA relaxed, welcoming singles-only vibeGood conversations, good coffee, zero pressureWho Is This ForSingles aged 21–35Working professionals / founders / freelancersComfortable with light running or brisk walkingPeople who enjoy social experiences without dating expectationsWhat’s Included☕ 3 coffees across partner cafés (from a select menu)🎁 Curated goodie bag🏃‍♀️ Event coordination & group leads🎲 Ice-breaker activities & games📸 Event photos & community content🤍 Access to future Tripper Trails events & tripsTicket Price₹899 + GST(Limited spots to keep the experience personal and fun.)Important NotesThis is a paid, curated experienceNot a dating or matchmaking eventRegistration confirmation is subject to review to maintain the event vibeOrganised ByTripper TrailsA Community-led travel & lifestyle experiences designed to bring people together IRL.

name: Midnight Diner: Tokyo - A Tribute by Chef Anumitra
description: Bento Bento Presents: Midnight Diner – Tokyo Stories - A Tribute by Chef AnumitraDuring the days of pandemic binge-watching, one series that captured hearts worldwide was the gentle and deeply human Midnight Diner: Tokyo Stories. Inspired by its warmth and storytelling, Chef Anumitra—after her successful tribute last year—brings back her heartfelt culinary homage to this beloved series at Bento Bento.Just like in Midnight Diner, where a late-night eatery in Tokyo serves dishes that resonate deeply with its customers' emotions and stories, this pop-up offers a curated menu featuring comfort dishes that bring both nostalgia and joy, featuring authentic Japanese ingredients, such as umeboshi, katsuobushi soyu, and Japanese mayo. Don't miss this chance to be a part of a comforting late-night community, in our cozy yet cute space, Bento Bento in Indiranagar.How It WorksYour ticket is your reservation! It's fully redeemable against the Midnight Diner dishes at the restaurant on the day of the event.  Please note: these tickets cannot be cancelled in case of no-shows.Menu: Midnight Diner – Tokyo StoriesStartersUmeboshi Onigiri (Veg) – A traditional rice ball, sticky rice encases the iconic Japanese pickled plum, balancing tartness and umami.Corn Dog (Veg) – A Japanese take on the classic street food, featuring a crispy, golden-brown batter.Ham Cutlet – Breaded and fried ham, offering a crispy exterior and tender, flavourful inside.Chicken Cheese Katsu – A Japanese-style chicken cutlet, with a melted cheese centre, encased in crisp panko.‘Octopus’ Wieners – Sausages carved into octopus shapes and deep-fried to perfection, a nostalgic favourite from Japanese lunchboxes.MainsTanmen (Veg Ramen) – A light yet flavourful vegetable ramen, comforting and wholesome.Tonteki – A pan-seared pork steak glazed with a savoury-sweet sauce, served with a side of greens.Crab Toshikoshi Soba – A dish traditionally eaten on New Year's Eve, featuring soba noodles in a light broth with crabsticks.Oyakodon – A beloved rice bowl dish featuring simmered chicken, egg, and onions in a savoury dashi sauce.Pork Miso Soup Set Menu – A hearty miso soup enriched with tender pork, served with rice and pickles.Sautéed Yam Set Menu (Veg) – A simple yet nourishing dish highlighting the natural sweetness of sautéed yam, served with rice and miso soup.Sides (Small Plates)Egg Tofu – A silky, custard-like tofu made with eggs, served chilled, with a light soy-based sauce.Pickled Napa Cabbage – A refreshing and crunchy pickled side dish to cleanse the palate. Potato Salad – A Japanese-style creamy potato salad with crunchy vegetables, eggs, and hints of mustard.Rice with Katsuobushi Soyu – Steamed rice topped with bonito flakes and seasoned soy sauce.Rice with Butter Soyu – A simple yet indulgent dish of warm rice mixed with butter and soy sauce. Boba, Beverages & Desserts also available!

name: In the Morning Light feat. Navya & Karthik
description: In the Morning Light is a concert series hosted at Ram’s Musique Experience, designed for unhurried listening in the quiet hours of the day. Curated as morning performances, the series invites audiences to experience music with attention, calm, and presence — before the noise of the day sets in.This edition of In the Morning Light features sitar artist Navya Rudrappa, accompanied by Karthik Bhat.Navya Rudrappa is known for her thoughtful, grounded approach to the sitar, drawing from Indian classical traditions while allowing space for reflection and subtle exploration. Her performances emphasise patience, tonal depth, and the natural unfolding of musical ideas — making her work especially resonant in an intimate morning setting.Accompanied by Karthik Bhat, the concert is shaped as a dialogue rather than a display — allowing rhythm, silence, and resonance to coexist. The focus remains on attentive listening, where the music is given time to breathe and settle.In the Morning Light is not about spectacle or volume. It is about beginning the day with intention — through music that unfolds slowly and stays with you.

name: KIDS SUSHI & SUNDAE WORKSHOP
description: AGES 6 - 13Let your little chefs step into a world of color, creativity, and hands-on food fun at our Kids Sushi & Sundae Workshop! This interactive session is specially designed for children to explore playful sushi-making and build their own dreamy dessert sundaes. It’s a perfect mix of learning, making, and munching in a safe, guided, and super fun studio environment.Children will roll, shape, assemble, and decorate their own creations while learning simple kitchen skills and presentation techniques. Best of all — they get to enjoy what they make and take home any extras.Hands-On ExperienceKids will prepare their own sushi-style creations . learning how to roll, layer, and assemble different sushi forms. They’ll also build fresh strawberry sundaes with toppings and sauces.MENU Rainbow Maki RollSushi Cones Sushi Muffins Fresh Strawberry Sundaes

name: Emotional Reset & Nervous System Healing w/ Sneha
description: This session is a sacred pause - an invitation to slow down, soften your inner world, and release the emotional weight you’ve been carrying. It’s a time to come back home to yourself, calm your nervous system, and restore inner balance.In this gently guided session, we’ll move through:✨ Breathwork - To ground the body and regulate the nervous system.🪞 Emotional Awareness Practice - Not to figure out your emotions, but to change your relationship with them - meeting what’s present with safety and compassion.🌿 Somatic Release Ritual - To help your body let go of stored stress and tension, creating a sense of lightness and ease.🎶 Sound Healing - To soothe, restore, and bring your system back into harmony.Together, we’ll create a space for emotional healing, deep rest, and inner safety.Come as you are, and allow yourself to soften, release, and reset. 💛
